ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.

A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.

name: r-corrr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-corrr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/corrr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/corrr/corrr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 386487d585db9504178b05270fb327d5e0cb742a68d6dd7136a61535ac22f11a

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.0
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.6.5
    - r-lazyeval >=0.2.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-purrr >=0.2.2
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-seriation >=1.2_0
    - r-tibble >=2.0
    - r-tidyr >=0.5.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.0
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.6.5
    - r-lazyeval >=0.2.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-purrr >=0.2.2
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-seriation >=1.2_0
    - r-tibble >=2.0
    - r-tidyr >=0.5.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('corrr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('corrr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - apcamargo

# Package: corrr
# Type: Package
# Version: 0.3.1
# Title: Correlations in R
# Description: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.
# Author:  Simon Jackson [aut, cre], Jorge Cimentada [ctb], Edgar Ruiz [aut]
# Maintainer: Edgar Ruiz <edgararuiz@gmail.com>
# URL: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr
# BugReports: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr/issues
# Depends: R (>= 3.3.0)
# LazyData: yes
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Suggests: testthat (>= 1.0.2), knitr (>= 1.13), rmarkdown (>= 0.9.6), dbplyr (>= 1.2.1), DBI, RSQLite
# Imports: dplyr (>= 0.8.0), magrittr (>= 1.5), tidyr (>= 0.5.1), ggplot2 (>= 2.2.0), seriation (>= 1.2-0), lazyeval (>= 0.2.0), purrr (>= 0.2.2), tibble (>= 2.0), ggrepel (>= 0.6.5), methods (>= 3.4.3), rlang(>= 0.2.0)
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-03-05 23:50:40 UTC; edgar
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-03-06 09:50:03 UTC
